site_name: The Barracks The KeepKingston Upon ThamesKT2 5UA
description: Demolition and rebuilding of parts of the East & West boundary walls to include repointing of existing brick work and vegetation growth removal from wall. New foundation to be laid and anchors supports
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: As required by Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of any replacement bricks to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority showing the proposed brick types, size, colour, texture, face bond and pointing proposed for any replacement bricks.The specification shall be submitted to the LPA and provided for inspection by officers on site and retained until details have been approved in writing. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples. Details of the extent of where the walls can be re-built using existing bricks, or where new bricks are being sourced to match shall also be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in writing.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Unless otherwise approved through this listed building consent, all new work and improvements must match the existing (original) in terms of the choice of materials, method of construction and finished appearance. The method of repointing hereby approved as part of this permission shall be traditionally undertaken by hand methods only, using a lime-based mortar only, tinted to a matching colour to that as existing. Any existing bricks should be retained or re-used where possible. Any bricks to be removed must be cut out by hand. Any replacement bricks must be fully tied into the wall following the original bond.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy CS8 and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

Within 3 months of completion of the permanent remedial works hereby approved, a Conservation Management Plan shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to include details of long-term monitoring of the listed wall. The development shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure appropriate ongoing conservation management of the heritage asset and safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy CS8 and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

Prior to commencement of the works hereby permitted, details shall be submitted to the local planning authority to confirm the repair of the full extent of Wall A. Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy CS8 and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
